```{r}
# Install necessary packages (only if not installed)
packages <- c("tidyverse", "data.table", "ggplot2", "dplyr", "readr", 
              "corrplot", "lme4", "car", "psych", "caret", "randomForest", 
              "xgboost", "igraph", "ggraph", "keras", "tensorflow", "GGally")

new_packages <- packages[!(packages %in% installed.packages()[,"Package"])]
if(length(new_packages)) install.packages(new_packages)

# Load all required libraries
library(tidyverse)    # Data manipulation and visualization
library(data.table)   # Fast data processing
library(ggplot2)      # Advanced visualization
library(dplyr)        # Data wrangling
library(readr)        # Efficient CSV reading
library(corrplot)     # Correlation analysis
library(lme4)         # Linear mixed models
library(car)          # Statistical analysis
library(psych)        # Descriptive statistics
library(caret)        # Machine learning utilities
library(randomForest) # Random Forest models
library(xgboost)      # XGBoost models
library(igraph)       # Graph-based models (GCN)
library(ggraph)       # Visualization for Graphs
library(keras)        # Deep Learning (Graph Convolutional Networks)
library(tensorflow)   # Backend for deep learning
library(GGally)       # Enhanced scatterplots and correlation matrices

# Ensure TensorFlow is initialized correctly
tensorflow::install_tensorflow()
```

```{r}
# Check for any loading errors
loaded_packages <- search()
missing_packages <- packages[!(paste("package:", packages, sep = "") %in% loaded_packages)]
if(length(missing_packages)) {
  print("⚠️ The following packages did not load correctly:")
  print(missing_packages)
} else {
  print("✅ All required packages are successfully loaded.")
}
```
